subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Result Logging
msgSnippet: JUnit provides an open TestListener interface. You are free to change the JUnit TestRunner interface to add additional listeners, which you may use for
messageBody:
JUnit provides an open TestListener interface. You are free to change the JUnit TestRunner interface to add additional listeners, which you may use for testing.

Enjoy.

So said Gupta, Vipul on 4/4/2003 --------------------
Hi Ravi & Nian,

Thanks for the inputs from ur side. I was going through the logging
mechanism and it is found that JUnit does not provide much for logging the
results in a separate file so that it can be used in the future. For that we
have to use other things like u told ANT. I searched the net in this case
and there I found the following comments at one of the site
(http://www.openfuture.de/Log4Unit/)

"Log4Unit is a JUnit extension combining JUnit with Log4J. The intention is
to create test protocols for JUnit.

JUnit is asymmetrical in the sense that it focusses on the documentation of
test failures and errors. Successful execution of a test case is not further
documented. In order to obtain a test protocol that documents the initial
settings, the test case execution and its results, a logging component is
required. Log4J as the current de facto standard is selected for this
extension.

The current version is 0.1.2 is available for download as
log4unit-0.1.2.tar.gz and log4unit-0.1.2.zip."

Has anyone tried the things or knows anything more about logging the results
or will I have to use ANT only.

Regards
Vipul


-----Original Message-----
From: ravi_chaddha [mailto:ravi_chaddha@...]
Sent: Thursday, April 03, 2003 8:30 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Re: [junit] JUnit Result Logging


You have <Junit> tag to call Junit test cases from Ant and you can
aggregate your reports into HTML etc by using <JUnitReport>


Good Luck,


Ravi Chaddha


Engineer QA


SNS Technologies Pvt. Ltd.,


Pune India


www.snstech.com

junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:

Vipul,

if i understand you right, i think you can use Ant with junit and
junitreport task which can generate the report for you.

for how to use, pls. refer to ant.apache.org.

best regards,

Liu, Nian
----- Original Message -----
From: "Gupta, Vipul" <Vipul.Gupta@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, April 02, 2003 5:32 PM
Subject: [junit] JUnit Result Logging


> Hi Friends,
>
> I am new to the JUnit group and also in the using of JUnit framework.
We
are
> migrating our projects into Java and so need some good test cases to be
made
> for the automated testing.
>
> Can anyone tell whether there is any method provided in JUnit to log
the
> test results so that one can have look on them later on.
>
> Regards
> Vipul
